title: 107_hr1898
content: The Act is titled the "International Commerce Enhancement Act" and references the Arms Export Control Act for amendments or repeals. It also addresses foreign and national security policy objectives and restraints. The International Commerce Enhancement Act makes amendments to the Arms Export Control Act, increasing the value of defense articles and services to $25,000,000 and $85,000,000 respectively. It also specifies exceptions for transfers to NATO, Japan, Australia, and New Zealand. LEASES OF DEFENSE ARTICLES AND LOAN AUTHORITY FOR COOPERATIVE RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT PURPOSES. Section 63(a) of the amendment increases the value of defense articles from $14,000,000 to $25,000,000 and from $50,000,000 to $85,000,000. Chapter 6 is also amended to require transmission of agreements not less than 30 days before entering into or renewing agreements with certain countries or organizations. In section 63(a), the value of defense articles is increased. The amendment strikes certain phrases and inserts new language in section 62(c).
